translation: Protect it 100,000 times and you'll become a great elder.

translation: Next, he teaches that the image of the Immovable One is painted according to the rules of deportment.

source_sentence: 於袈裟上畫　　聖者無動尊
translation: On top of the monk's robe, he paints the image of the sage Akṣobhya

source_sentence: 右垂一索髮　　左目而現眇
translation: hanging down a rope on the right side, he shows it with his left eye

source_sentence: 右手操銳劍　　左手執羂索
translation: In his right hand he holds a sharp sword, and in his left hand he holds a rope.

source_sentence: 安坐寶盤山　　現叱咤喑鳴
translation: He sits comfortably on a jeweled tray of the mountain and appears to shout and wail.

source_sentence: 作怖三界相　　其身遍青色
translation: They become frightened by the signs of the three realms, and their bodies are all blue-colored.

source_sentence: 上言袈裟畫　　或赤或乾陀
translation: the above-mentioned words are painted with a monk's robe, either red or gandharva

source_sentence: 褐色等繒綵　　是名為袈裟
translation: It's called a monk's robe when it's made of coarse silk such as the color of hemp.

source_sentence: 畫像作成就　　置赴海河邊
translation: When the image is painted and completed, it's placed at the edge of a sea or river

source_sentence: 修行者衣服　　所差色如像
translation: The clothes of the practitioners are the same color as an image.

source_sentence: 屏捨諸世務　　斷諸異言說
translation: to abstain from worldly affairs and cut off divergent speech

source_sentence: 乞食作念誦　　滿五洛叉遍
translation: to beg for food and recite it five lakṣas per minute

source_sentence: 數畢便斷食　　滿一日一夜
translation: After finishing the number, he then stops eating for one day and night

source_sentence: 應以戰娜迦　　其形似畢豆
translation: You should use a cānaka whose shape resembles a pitu

source_sentence: 和酥作護摩　　一萬數為極
translation: mix it with butter to make a guard and moisten it 10,000 times as great

source_sentence: 無動尊現身　　奉事修行者
translation: Venerable Akṣobhya manifests his body to serve the practitioner

source_sentence: 猶如婆誐鑁　　得三摩地成
translation: It's like the vātsīputrīya who attains samādhi.

source_sentence: 與諸大菩薩　　得同共止住
translation: and the great bodhisattvas can live together with one another

source_sentence: 復次畫像法　　取死人衣服
translation: Furthermore, the method of painting an image takes the clothes of a dead man.

source_sentence: 畫聖無動尊　　相貌如前說
translation: the depicted sage Akṣobhya, whose appearance is as described above

source_sentence: 刺取自身血　　畫無動像眼
translation: to pierce one's own blood and draw the eye of a motionless image

source_sentence: 安像面於西　　真言行菩薩
translation: An image is placed facing west, and the bodhisattva practices with true words.

source_sentence: 面東對像坐　　三時皆澡浴
translation: To the east of his face, he sat facing the image and bathed at three times.

source_sentence: 著所浴濕衣　　斷語作持誦
translation: wearing the wet clothes you bathe, cutting off speech and chanting

source_sentence: 滿一十萬遍　　以諸雜飲食
translation: to recite it 100,000 times with various foods

source_sentence: 施一切鬼神　　黑月分八日
translation: bestow all the spirits on the eighth day of the black moon

source_sentence: 斷食一日夜　　取一未壞屍
translation: One day and night, he stops eating and takes a corpse that hasn't been destroyed.

source_sentence: 遍身者瘢痕　　諸根皆全具
translation: Pervasive body is a scar, and all the faculties are fully present

source_sentence: 少年好丈夫　　得如是死屍
translation: A young man who is good-looking gets a dead corpse like this

source_sentence: 當坐於心上　　念誦一萬遍
translation: You should sit on your heart and recite it 10,000 times.

source_sentence: 其屍即動搖　　明者不應怖
translation: The corpse then shook, and the wise man shouldn't be afraid.

source_sentence: 屍口出妙蓮　　便即須割取
translation: When a wonderful lotus comes out of the corpse's mouth, it must be cut and taken

source_sentence: 執之便騰空　　成就持明仙
translation: cling to it, they'll then rise up into emptiness and accomplish the sage who maintains insight.

source_sentence: 身狀如梵天　　得為仙中王
translation: His body shape is like that of the Brahma gods, and he becomes the king of sages.

source_sentence: 若對像三時　　念誦滿六月
translation: If he recites it to the image at three times for six months

source_sentence: 隨力辦供養　　燒悼沈水香
translation: to make offerings according to one's ability, burning the incense of mourning and shedding water

source_sentence: 得成就惹位　　又法加幢幡
translation: to attain the stage of ācāra, and then he'll be able to add banners and streamers to the Dharma

source_sentence: 一千遍滿足　　能降伏他軍
translation: thousand times fulfilled, he can subdue the armies of others

source_sentence: 若止諸冤敵　　畫黃色大身
translation: If you stop enemies, paint a large yellow-colored body

source_sentence: 四面手亦四　　口出現利牙
translation: The four sides are also four hands, and the mouth produces sharp teeth.

source_sentence: 作大暴惡形　　遍身成火焰
translation: to create a great violent form that pervades the body and becomes a flame of fire

source_sentence: 作吞他力相　　所有戰陣時
translation: to create the characteristic of the power of swallowing others when there's a battlefield

source_sentence: 置像於軍前　　猶如以羂索
translation: put the image in front of an army just as if it were a rope

source_sentence: 作攝縛彼相　　令使他歸降
translation: to act to gather those characteristics so that they will cause others to return

source_sentence: 若欲成敬愛　　以鹽作彼形
translation: If they want to become respectful, they make their form with salt.

source_sentence: 稱名而片割　　護摩七日內
translation: to call it by its name and cut it into pieces, guarding it for seven days

source_sentence: 設有大威德　　咸來伏從之
translation: Even if there is great authority and virtue, all come to subdue it.

source_sentence: 又一成就法　　若底花護摩
translation: Also, there's one accomplished dharma that protects the flower with its base and guards it

source_sentence: 滿一十萬遍　　得藥廁抳來
translation: If you recite it 100,000 times, you'll attain the medicine that comes from the toilet.

source_sentence: 伏從持明者　　復次護摩法
translation: He who subdues those who maintain insight and furthermore protects the Dharma.

source_sentence: 以旋風所飄　　葉作護摩事
translation: By being blown by a whirling wind, the leaves perform protective functions

source_sentence: 得彼著顛狂　　又攝召護摩
translation: to attain their attachment to delusion and also gather the summons and guards

source_sentence: 鹽作護摩事　　能攝諸天女

source_sentence: 及召仙女等　　又法安悉香
translation: and summoned the sage maidens and so forth, as well as the fragrance of Fa'an si

source_sentence: 作護摩事業　　得為國大臣
translation: to perform the duty of guarding and moistening, and become a minister of state

source_sentence: 又法畫釋迦　　牟尼如來像

source_sentence: 右邊畫文殊　　童子之形像
translation: On the right side, he depicts Mañjuśrī in the form of a boy

source_sentence: 左畫金剛手　　菩薩微笑形
translation: Vajrapāṇi on the left, in the form of a bodhisattva smiling

source_sentence: 於下畫無動　　大威怒金剛
translation: At the bottom, he paints the great wrathful vajra of immovability

source_sentence: 著種種瓔珞　　嚴飾身支分
translation: wearing various kinds of jewelry, adorning the body limbs

source_sentence: 畫畢於像前　　念誦五十萬

source_sentence: 一切皆成辦　　打賊用眼印
translation: everything is accomplished, the eye mudrā for beating thieves

source_sentence: 誦吽字真言　　所有諸冤敵
translation: Recite the true words of the Sanskrit letter un and all the enemies there are.

source_sentence: 能使著顛狂　　真言者不捨
translation: It can cause attachment to delusion, but the true speaker doesn't abandon it.

source_sentence: 乃至置殞滅　　復次成敬愛
translation: Even if it is postponed and extinguished, it will furthermore become venerated.

source_sentence: 以燒死屍灰　　加持一七遍
translation: to burn the ashes of dead corpses one or seven times

source_sentence: 散於彼身上　　即敬愛成就
translation: scattered on their bodies, that is the accomplishment of respect and affection

source_sentence: 又法以牛黃　　加持一七遍
translation: Another teaching is to bless it one or seven times with a cow's yellow color.

source_sentence: 點置於眉間　　一切皆伏從
translation: place the dots between your eyebrows and all subdue them

source_sentence: 無復違拒者　　復次觀自身
translation: There is no further disobedience. Furthermore, he observes himself

source_sentence: 成本尊形狀　　以真言文字
translation: It's the form of the honored one, using true words and words.

source_sentence: 布身諸支分　　一百由旬內
translation: within one hundred yojanas from the parts of the body that are spread out

source_sentence: 所有難調御　　鬼神所持者
translation: all that is difficult to tame, maintained by ghosts and spirits

source_sentence: 皆悉能散壞　　又正報盡者
translation: They are all capable of disintegrating, and the righteous retribution is exhausted.

source_sentence: 能延六月住　　又法壁畫劍
translation: He can stay for six months, and he's also painted with a sword on the wall of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 以俱哩迦龍　　纏交於劍上
translation: He's tethered by the Kukkuṭika dragon on top of his sword

source_sentence: 加持一千遍　　劍中觀婀字
translation: he recites it 1,000 times, observing the letter rāzhu in the sword.

source_sentence: 發生威焰光　　令病者看之
translation: to give rise to the radiance of a majestic flame and cause sick people to see it

source_sentence: 便即阿尾捨　　問者皆實說
translation: Then the āveśayana, whoever asks questions, is really saying them.

source_sentence: 若能於每日　　誦一百八遍
translation: If you can recite it one hundred and eight times a day

source_sentence: 無動尊常逐　　修真言菩薩
translation: Venerable Akṣobhya always chasing the bodhisattva who cultivates true words

source_sentence: 每食餘殘者　　以置於淨處
translation: Every time he eats leftover food, he puts it in a clean place.

source_sentence: 奉獻無動使　　隨心獲悉地
translation: offerings to the immovable messenger who follows his heart and attains enlightenment

source_sentence: 又法於分怒　　誦吽字真言
translation: Furthermore, the teaching is to recite the true words of the Sanskrit phoneme anger in terms of anger.

source_sentence: 能止雲雨等　　又法以刺木
translation: It can stop clouds, rain, etc., and so forth, and it's also possible to pierce wood

source_sentence: 作護摩事業　　能止大風雨
translation: to perform the duty of protecting and moistening [the earth], able to stop wind and rain

source_sentence: 復能成眾事　　復次畫像法
translation: Furthermore, they can accomplish many things. Furthermore, they paint images and dharmas.

source_sentence: 於袈裟上畫　　應作青黑色
translation: On the top of the monk’s robe should be painted blue and black

source_sentence: 髮向左邊垂　　作童真形狀
translation: hanging down to the left side in the shape of a youth

source_sentence: 手操爍訖底　　或執嚩日囉
translation: hand gestures shining with their feet or holding a vajra

source_sentence: 眼睛色微赤　　威焰光赫奕
translation: His eyes are slightly red in color, and his majestic flame shines brilliantly.

source_sentence: 坐於盤山上　　其山色赤黃
translation: He was seated on the top of Mount Pan, a red and yellow colored mountain.

source_sentence: 著青色衣服　　作孩子相貌
translation: to wear blue clothes and make a childlike appearance

source_sentence: 對此畫像形　　結一切密印
translation: knot all the mysterious mudrās on the shape of this painted image

source_sentence: 皆悉得成就　　先所思念事
translation: They all attain the accomplishment of whatever they thought before.

source_sentence: 若舊若新等　　皆悉得成就
translation: Whether old or new, they all attain their accomplishment.

source_sentence: 所有隱形法　　輪劍飛空藥
translation: all the hidden dharmas that are possessed by the wheel-sword flying space medicine

source_sentence: 若無是畫像　　但於寂靜處
translation: If there is no such thing as a painted image, it's only in a quiet place

source_sentence: 念誦皆成就　　又法或以鏡
translation: Each recitation is accomplished either by means of a mirror or another teaching.

source_sentence: 中看一切事　　或辟畫像上
translation: all things in the middle are seen or painted on an image

source_sentence: 問看諸事等　　皆得隨意應
translation: all the things that are asked and seen can be done as they wish

source_sentence: 又法以無病　　童男或童女
translation: Furthermore, it's because of the absence of illness that a boy or girl is born.

source_sentence: 作阿尾捨法　　問三世諸事
translation: to make an abhidharma and ask questions about the affairs of the three times

source_sentence: 皆悉得成辦　　復次說使者
translation: They all attain their accomplishment. Furthermore, they are said to be messengers.

source_sentence: 成就之法門　　起黑月一日
translation: the accomplished dharma-gate arises on the first day of the black moon

source_sentence: 對像三時念　　各一百八遍
translation: one hundred and eight times each of the three moments of thought with respect to an image

source_sentence: 至白十五日　　月輪圓滿時
translation: On the fifteenth day of the month, when the moon wheel is complete

source_sentence: 如前所演說　　最初承事法
translation: As explained above, the first is to serve the Dharma.

source_sentence: 以苦練木柴　　及以白芥子
translation: With wooden sticks made of asuras and white mustard seed

source_sentence: 從黃昏起首　　護摩至夜半
translation: From the twilight rising from the head, he guards it until midnight

source_sentence: 使者即來赴　　不來盡一夜
translation: The messengers will come and go without coming for an entire night

source_sentence: 決定來出現　　來問持明者
translation: They will surely appear in the future, and come to ask questions of those who preserve their insight.

source_sentence: 求乞進止等　　隨意而處分
translation: seeking, begging, advancing, stopping, etc., and so forth, according to their wishes

source_sentence: 皆悉依奉行　　若欲往天宮
translation: They all rely on and serve them if they want to go to the palace of heaven.

source_sentence: 使者戴接往　　使取天帝釋
translation: The messenger carries it and sends it to the god Indra, who takes it.

source_sentence: 妃后婇女等　　亦皆能將來
translation: The queens, queens, palace ladies, and so forth can all come.

source_sentence: 若所須宮觀　　皆悉能成辦
translation: Whatever is needed, the palace and contemplation can be accomplished.

source_sentence: 若齒木淨水　　塗掃等事業
translation: If the teeth, wood, clean water, mud, sweeping, and other works

source_sentence: 悉皆能為作　　所使令作者
translation: They can all be created for the sake of what they are entrusted with and cause others to create it.

source_sentence: 一切能成辦　　如聖者所須
translation: everything that can be accomplished just as the noble person requires

source_sentence: 皆使成辦之　　若一夜護摩
translation: They are all made to be accomplished if they guard and moisten them overnight.

source_sentence: 使者不出現　　彼即決定死
translation: If the messenger does not appear, he will surely die.

source_sentence: 聖者無動使　　法門說已竟
translation: The noble one is the messenger of immovability, having explained the teachings of the Dharma-gate
